title: "Buff Lucian"
body: No please do NOT buff Lucian damage-wise. Nobody wants another Lucian Meta.

replies.body: lucian's main problem (balance-wise) is his mobility which gives him constant self-peel. marksmen already have a support on standby waiting to heal, shield, and peel for them. lucian and a few other marksmen push this level of safety even further by having lots of mobility. The result from all of these levels of safety heavily skews which champions are viable because half the cast of champions cannot reach them unless the marksman and support mess up. It's the kalista dilemma all over again. lucian has been the generalist adc for forever because riot won't give him a strategic gameplay identity with a real weakness.
500 AA range. That is the main reason lucian is not played. Honestly, if they reverted him back to 550, i think he'd be fine bot lane, the issue would just be other roles.
525 is more reasonable

Vayne has a decent base attack range compared to other champions.
She has a higher range than {{champion:104}} ( 425 ) , {{champion:15}} &{{champion:236}}  & {{champion:96}} +++ new _**Kai'Sa **_ ( 500 ) ,  {{champion:222}}  & {{champion:498}}  & {{champion:133}}  & {{champion:429}} (525 ).

She shares her base attack range of 550 with {{champion:119}} ,{{champion:42}} ,{{champion:21}} ,{{champion:202}} ,{{champion:29}} ,{{champion:18}} & {{champion:81}} 
The only ones who's base AA range is bigger than hers are {{champion:110}}  ( 575 ) , {{champion:22}}  ( 600 )  and {{champion:51}}  ( 650)

ADCs who out range her via abilities  are {{champion:29}} ,{{champion:222}} , {{champion:18}}  , {{champion:203}} {{champion:96}} . {{champion:51}} 

550 is one of the most common base AA ranges for ranged champions,followed by 525 and 500. 
11 out of 141 champions  ( Kai'Sa included)  out range her with base or/and abilities. That's only 7.8% of the champions.
Out of 68 ranged champions ( If I counted correctly)  32 have lower range than her, that's 47.06%  . She shares her range with 25 other champions,that's 36.76% ,so only 16.18% % of ranged champions out range her( either with their base,later in the game,with ability actives.stacks etc.).

_**So,statistically speaking {{champion:67}} is a bit of above medium attack range for ranged champions,but when compared to only the marksmen class. she's still in a decent spot **_

NOTE: I'm not saying she's OP,but people on the boards are using this ˝She has low range˝  is not correct,if,however you're referring to abilities as well, take into consideration that Vayne is pretty mobile and with her stealth can even unable champions to click on her.

Vayne's range is more about effective range than attack range. Sivir can do damage with Q and W that exceed her attack range. Xayah's passive, Q, and E (and technically R) all exceed her attack range, etc.

Vayne doesn't have that. I think her E range is slightly longer than AA range, but even then, the range at which Vayne can deal damage is pretty low. But you're definitely right in that her attack range isn't that short. Her effective range is.

Are we really going to pretend that Sivir does any significant damage with her Q post 2-3 items? x)

Or that Xayah does with her passive or Q?

Issue here is that the moment Vayne gets attackspeed and boots along with a bit of AD she becomes insanely hard to kite, chase and kill....all while maintaining high kill pressure on the enemies between the now usual critbuild and her W. 

There isn't any condition like Xayah having to hit her E or sivir Q, just hit 6, gets some attackspeed and wreck someone. 


Post 1-2 items Vayne doesn't have any significant weakness aside from lack of ability to harass.-.....which might not even be a factor given how easily she can both followup and engage by herself.

Xayah's E is a significant damage source, and the range for that comes from her passive or Q. Seems relevant for the discussion of effective range. If you'd prefer a more obvious and clear cut examples, there's also Ezreal Q, Varus Q, Ashe W, Caitlyn Q and passive (combined with W or E), Corki R, Jhin R. Vayne's short range becomes much more apparent in comparison to these.

I'm not disputing that Vayne is hard to kite or kill or whatever. I'm only saying that her effective range is short.

Indeed, Xayah´s E is significant.

But do you know what it has that Vayne doesn't?

A requirement for damage, it needs feathers and it needs to actually hit, both can be dodged unlike anything Vayne does.


Issue is the manner the damage is dealt and how much, Xayah isn't problematic because there is so much setup involved to get a good E off, which is why a good E is worth so much more than say Ashe W.

In my mind, effective range is the range off which a champ can kill a target, a zone in which they can start a fight and kill you.

Some champ can harass at great distance, but they have to actually get closer if they want to kill you.


And so, Vaynes short range becomes much less of a problem, she just needs to ulti+Q and suddenly her target is well inside Vayne's kill zone, 3-5 autos later and the target dies with nothing they could have done to stop her while she gets to have tools for self preservation.

Ashe gets to be gimped in damage to have her ulti and slows, Cait gets lower base ATS than any other marksman to compensate for her passive and koggy is the most hopeless at defending himself.

Vayne has only slightly shorter range than Ashe, deals way more damage and a ton of true damage, has self peel from Q, invis, and E, no particular "lower" base stats like cait or trist.

Heck she doesn't even struggle much, only matchups that she does "somewhat" bad into are Twitch,Varus and Draven, but even then the matchup stats are like 48% winrate into those at worst, some other lanes when bad have like 40% winrate when hardcountered. 


Not really weak early, insane snowball potential, does selfpeel, anti tank, burst and mobility.

Even Twitch is weak in lane <.<
Vayne is also purely single target.

Believe it or not but aside from Koggy and Varus most marksmen are, those two just happen to have extremely good ruunan synergy...and twitch with his ultimate base functions.

Pretty sure kog is the only AD that can use Ruunan as well as he does though.
Not at all. I can't think of one other Adc that does not have some sort of Aoe ability.
AOE harass and consistent AOE damage the style of Kog are two very different things x)
My point is that Vayne is single target damage that can not Aoe, since people forget about that weakness.

Is that really a weakness when only two others in the role can do proper AOE?

They more along the lines of being exceptions than Vayne is for not having AOE.

Ashe W, ~90-250 damage on each target, such impressive AOE, or maybe Varus Q for a similar number. 

And dont go mixing in Ruunan, it doesn't actually add in much if you don't have stuff like Twitch passive, kog W or a lot of on hit damage built in like Kayle. 

And even then you kinda need range to really get anywhere.

Xayah´s E rarely hits more than 1 person in a teamfight, and it's the one going after her.

Sivir´s richochet? You mean the one that needs people to stand in a area about as big as a brand W for it to actually bounce and hit them all? If you say so....

Twitch is one of the exceptions i mentioned, kog is the other if you forgot.

AOE knockback is not the same as consistent AOE damage, and it won't be used to clear waves.

Vayne gets static shiv as her first or second item, then she starts farming champions, what a shame that killing minions takes a bit more time........except it doesn't when she has it+IE and maybe rapidfire, then it's pretty much instant.

And most champs in botlane can't spam crazy early, they run outa mana and then they´ll be forced to recall or die/burn summs of enemy all in so hardly anyone does it.

Xayah E is very strong
Sivir ricochet is very strong in team fights
Twitch can hit 5 people
Even trist has an Aoe knockback

And it is a weakness, it is harder to wave clear larger waves.
